text:
and he is about
to blow all our minds.
Watch this.

Mike: There's a physical ceiling
for everybody,

but mentally, nobody knows
what those limits are.
I'm known as the Mind Boss.

I've cultivated the ability to
withstand extreme impact forces,

resist puncture,
and generate internal power.
Things that look physical,

but the real strength
is mental strength.

I'm not a magician
or illusionist.

What you see is
what's actually happening.

In round one,
there is a physical risk,
and it could very well be fatal,

but I'm interested in exploring
my own personal boundaries.

We're all capable of so much
more than we realize,

and that capability
resides within the mind.
[ Cheers and applause ]
I see tools and a watermelon.

Watermelons don't do well
on our show.

None of this is safe.
I can already tell that.

Hi, judges.
Everything that I do is real.

Everything that you will see
on stage is real.

Tonight, I'm gonna be
testing myself against impact,

compression,
and penetrating forces.

-Ah.
-I love this.

This is a 6-foot length
of #3-grade rebar.

In order to bend it,
I'm gonna be pushing

directly against the bar
using nothing but my throat.

Now, to give you an idea
of what rebar can do

if things don't go
exactly as planned...
Oh, no.

That's gonna be
his throat.

Mike: I'm gonna need some
additional muscle on stage,

so if I could get T-Pain
and Cody
to join us up here, please.

-Yeah!
-Ah! [ Laughs ]
Go on up, gentlemen.

If you can stand
behind Leeland...
T-Pain: Okay.

Go ahead and extend
your arms

completely straight
with your hands

on each one of
his shoulders.

The idea is he's
basically my fulcrum.

-Okay.
-Got you.
As much as I can.
Fulcrum, by the way.

And so that you can see
where this is going...
[ Audience gasping ]
On three.
One, two, three.

Oh, no!
Wow!
[ Cheers and applause ]
Whoo!

-It bent.
-And there it is.

You know what? My blood pressure
cannot handle this show.

All right, T-pain, you can
go ahead and have a seat.

Cody, can I impose on you
to stay up here
one more moment, please?

Cody's very strong.
I'm his weight-lifting coach.

I taught him all --
everything he knows.
Okay.

I'm gonna be using this bed
of broken glass.
No, no, no, no.

I'm gonna be laying down
on this glass.

Leeland is gonna take
this concrete block

and place it
on my midsection.

Cody, I need you to break
that block using this.

No.
This is not a good idea.
[ Exhales sharply ]
[ Groans ]
And now the block.
Okay.

If this goes through,
am I gonna hurt you?
Let's find out.

This is the most
dangerous show ever.
Oh!
Are you ready?
Ready.
Nope.
All right, so, one...
A little higher.

...two...
[ Exhales sharply ]
...and three.
Oh, God!

Ooh.
Holy shit.
Are you okay?

Oh, my gosh.
[ T-Pain laughs ]
Yes!
There's still glass.
Get the glass out of him!
Wow, wow, sir.
Holy shit.

How do you not get
any cuts on your throat?

It just hasn't
done that yet.
Oh. Cody.

I thought, "Oh, mind over
matter, oh," but yes,

I just smashed
a fully loaded sledgehammer

on an actual concrete block
on another human being

while they were laying on glass,
and that was very impressive.

Jennifer.
I loved it.

I'm always impressed
and always really moved

by what human beings
can do with their minds.
Thank you.
T-Pain, rebar with his throat?

Yeah, I wasn't ready
for that at all.

Seeing you just come full-charge
at us scared the hell out of me.
That was great, man.
That was nice. Okay.
